front.title: Usage Scenarios of a User Registration Protocol (URP)

abstract.t: Many different kinds of commercial networks require users to perform registration before being allowed usage to resources. Resources could include basic access to the network to resources that are more specific such as services in the network or a certain grade of service, etc. The registration process is normally specific to the type of network that a user is attaching to and the registration process itself occurs in the protocol layers that are specific to an access technology. With a network layer (IP) or above solution, a common protocol for performing registration could be defined.
